page.title: 01Area Around Gight Castle
page.content: This area is split by the river Ythan, Gight Castle being the centre point. The area is sparsely populated and virtually all the population are involved in farming. All the available land is intensively farmed, producing cereal crops. The river Ythan and its banks provided a spectacular contrast to the flat, though high land around it. This part of the valley is virtually unspoilt with its dramatic high, wooded banks and rough, marshy lower banks. This provides a habitat for a wide variety of wild-life. The ruins of Gight Castle standing high above the Ythan add to the natural splendour of the area.
